New Records: Christian Eriksen won his 133rd cap, a record for a male Danish player.
Key Match Events: Pierre-Emile Højbjerg reacted after Joachim Anderson’s own goal was disallowed for offside.
Christian Eriksen's snapshot from 19 yards was turned behind by Predrag Rajkovic.
Denmark had the ball in the net from a corner but it was disallowed as the ball had bent out of play.
Andreas Skov Olsen's drive was deflected wide.
Joachim Andersen's own goal was disallowed for offside against Tadic in the build-up.
Jannik Vestergaard planted a free header right into the hands of Rajkovic.
Aleksandar Mitrovic was booked for his vehement complaint after attempting to win a penalty.
A pitch invader interrupted the match after running 75 yards before being hauled to the ground.
Pre-Game Insights: Kasper Hjulmand expressed optimism about facing Germany, stating, 'When we play the big nations, we always step up.'
Dragan Stojkovic dropped key players Filip Mladenovic, Dusan Vlahovic, and Dusan Tadic, which surprised even the Danish coach.
Post-Match Reflections: Kasper Hjulmand expressed a good feeling about the upcoming game against Germany.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a stiflingly hot evening in Bavaria.
The atmosphere was flat and the first period was messy and lacking in cohesion.
Serbian fans threw beer cups towards Eriksen as he took a corner.
Serbian fans continued to throw beer cups after Joachim Andersen's own goal was disallowed.
Kasper Schmeichel took time to remove beer cups from his penalty area one by one.
